Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Sugammadex on Postoperative Urinary Retention

Intervention.evidence: comparing sugammadex with conventional reversal agents or no reversal agents

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effects of sugammadex, a neuromuscular blockade (NMB) reversal agent, on POUR incidence and other postoperative outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was POUR incidence, measured within 30 days post-surgery.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 25 studies with 163,367 patients were included: 84,362 received sugammadex, and 79,005 received neostigmine or no antagonist.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Sugammadex significantly reduced POUR incidence (Relative Risk (RR): 0.47, 95% Confidence Interval (CI): 0.34â€“0.64, P < 0.001).
